summary: Most branding updates are implemented: header text and logo alt use a centralized BRANDING constant, About section references BRANDING.appName, footer copyright uses BRANDING.appName, and footer non-browser fallback slug uses BRANDING.appSlug. However, the HTML entry title remains hardcoded, which likely breaks the “single source of truth” requirement for the document title/rename-in-one-place goal.

missing_requirements.requirement: Centralize the site/app name in a single frontend constant/module and refactor all components that display the site name to use that constant so future renames do not require hunting for duplicated strings (including document title).
missing_requirements.reason: The app name still appears as a hardcoded string in frontend/index.html (<title>TorqueShine Supply - ...</title>), meaning a future rename would require changing both the centralized module/env and index.html to keep them aligned.

hallucinated_features.description: Added an environment-variable based branding system (VITE_APP_NAME, VITE_APP_SLUG) and committed a frontend/.env file.
hallucinated_features.reason: The request only asked to centralize the name in a frontend constant/module; it did not explicitly request adding environment variables or a .env file.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a centralized tagline ("Premium Car Care Products") and used it to set document.title formatting.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest did not ask to add or change a tagline; it only requested renaming "AutoGleam Supply" to "TorqueShine Supply" and centralizing the site/app name and slug.
